summary: This document is an email chain from May 3, 2021, regarding a victim services request. A victim of child sex abuse and sex trafficking reaches out to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking assistance and participation in the investigation of the cases against Ghislaine Maxwell and the late Jeffrey Epstein. The email chain shows coordination between the victim, the U.S. Attorney's Office, and the FBI to connect the victim with services.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the case 'United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell' being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York for charges including enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the case 'United States vs. Jeffrey Epstein', who had been arrested and died by suicide while in confinement, accused of sex trafficking and sexual exploitation of children.

connections.description: Both are named as defendants in related federal cases for crimes involving the sexual exploitation of minors, with Maxwell's case being actively prosecuted and Epstein's case closed due to his death.

events.title: Victim Services Request Email
events.description: A victim of child sex abuse and sex trafficking emails the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to request assistance and participate in the investigation of the Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein cases.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in confinement after his arrest, which closed his criminal case.

events.title: Prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The case 'United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell' is actively being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York for charges including enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A victim of child sex abuse and sex trafficking reached out to the U.S. Attorney's Office in May 2021 seeking to participate in the investigations related to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

The case against Ghislaine Maxwell was actively being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York as of May 2021, with charges including enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.
Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case was no longer active due to his death by suicide while in confinement.
The email chain shows coordination between the victim, the U.S. Attorney's Office, and the FBI to connect the victim with victim services.
The victim indicates there are 'other people' who are also victims of the crimes associated with Maxwell and Epstein.
